Commentary: great line first up, full on off stump and swinging into the left-hander's pads, defended

Commentary: full on middle and off, prods forward and blocks off the front foot

Commentary: full on leg stump, flicked off his pads to fine leg. Misfield in the deep from Lakmal but no extra runs given away

Commentary: full outside off, leans into the drive on this occasion. Firmly hit past cover, and chase for the infielders once again

Commentary: full on off stump, quick to get onto the front foot and defended

Commentary: full on off stump, angling across the left-hander but pushed to mid off for a quick single. They scamper across

Commentary: back of a length outside off, straight through to the keeper with no shot offered

Commentary: misses the wrong'un and he's given lbw. He won't review it. Superb bowling from Sandakan. Slips in the one that comes in and beats the inside edge after drawing him forward. Kayes leaves the gap between bat and pad and he's trapped in front. It appeared to be going high on first look*, but they've decided against the review. * Replays of Kayes' lbw showed that the ball would have gone over leg stump.

Commentary: got him! Lakmal has found the edge. Looks a harmless delivery, really. Good length at a sixth stump line, going straight through. He's marginally inside the line and a tad late on the forward block. A straightforward catch for Dickwella. He falls nine short of the hundred. A solid innings from him comes to a close - his first as a pure batsman in his entire career
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, OUT
Dismissal_text: Mushfiqur Rahim c †Dickwella b Lakmal 92 (192b 10x4 0x6) SR: 47.91

Commentary: oho, a rather tame end to what has been a sparkling innings. This has come against the run of play, out of rather nowhere. Mominul clips a fuller one on the pads but uses hard wrists and chips it in the air. Short leg takes a good reflex catch at an awkward height, above the chest region, with both hands. Sri Lanka strike early on the second morning

Commentary: that could be out. Has he been strangled down the leg side? The umpire goes upstairs to check this stumping chance. It's too full on leg stump, he walks forward and tries to clip it away but the ball sneaks from underneath and goes to the keeper. He has overbalanced and walked forward and the keeper takes the bails off. And though he slides it back in after turning around, it's a fraction of a second too late. Good hand from Sunzamul, ends is unexpected fashion

Commentary: a stunning catch from Mushfiqur to end Kusal's innings on 196! I wonder if tea approaching had anything to do with that stroke, it was full outside off, but Kusal came charging down, looking to flick the ball over midwicket - probably the wrong shot selection, considering it was against the spin, but he has done it so easily that complacency may have crept in. Mushfiqur keeps his eyes on the ball right through its trajectory, till when it's in his hands. Made significant ground to his right from mid-on, good diving catch
Commentary_short: Taijul Islam to Mendis, OUT
Dismissal_text: BKG Mendis c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taijul Islam 196 (327b 22x4 2x6) SR: 59.93

Commentary: silly point has taken this and they've appealed. Mushfiq pushing on the front foot outside off. he's got bat on it and it has bounced up to silly point. The question here is whether it bounced off his boot. It was close. They've sent it upstairs with soft signal not out. It doesn't look good for Mushfiq though. This appears to have gone straight into his boot...and the catch is take cleanly! Herath has snapped one in the last over and it's Mushfiqur Rahim! Silly point leaps forward with his right hand to take a catch and then make a review. He was confident about this. Kusal Mendis is the man under the lid.

Commentary: Eighty-seven players have played Test cricket for Bangladesh, and Mominul is the first one to score a hundred in each innings of a Test. Take a bow, Mominul. Tossed up outside off, not much turn, Mominul stretches out and drives with an open face to cover-point. He soaks in the moment, and gets a hug from Liton. Subdued celebrations for a significant landmark

Commentary: Dilruwan tears back from mid-off and hangs onto a skier. Herath strikes with the second new ball. Tossed up outside off and turns away, Liton dares to step out. But is is nowhere close to the pitch and ends up shooting this up in the air. What was Liton even thinking? Dilruwan runs back from mid-off, gets into a side-on position, but still manages to hold his balance. He looks over his right shoulder and takes it to deny Liton a maiden Test hundred. Anyone sensing a collapse?
Commentary_short: Herath to Liton Das, OUT
Dismissal_text: Liton Das c Perera b Herath 94 (182b 11x4 0x6) SR: 51.64
